node.doctext:
Yours, bookmarked

I wrote this because I think that [seeing your nodes linked in other user bookmarks is really satisfying]. May a god help and it would turn into a real superdoc.

2003.03.07 at 06:53 [dann] says After talking it over with Jay, I think it's probably not the best of ideas to put something like that into effect, to put any sort of weight on what bookmarks represent. If bookmarks were instead called "favorites", we might have something discrete and meaninful to show users in another way "you're appreciated". For now, though, the bookmark system just isn't structured that way. too many users boomkark random things to read later, too many editors use it as a 'to be killed' list -- there's no guarantee A of permanence or benevolence when someone bookmarks anything. sorry :/ 

[%
# This superdoc shows to a user about who have bookmarked his nodes.

my $LINKTYPE = getNode('bookmark', 'linktype');

my $csr = $DB->sqlSelectMany("links.*", 
"links right join node on node.author_user=$$USER{node_id} AND ". 
"links.to_node=node.node_id", "links.linktype=$$LINKTYPE{node_id}");

$csr->execute;

my $retstr = '';
my $bookmark;

$bookmark = $csr->fetchrow_hashref;
if (!$bookmark) {
    $retstr .= "<i>No one has bookmarked your nodes.</i>";
} else {
    my $bookmarked_node = $$bookmark{to_node};
    $retstr .= "<ul>";
    
    NODES: {
        do {
            $retstr .= "<li>".linkNode($bookmarked_node). ", by: ";
            my $users = "";
            USERS: {
                do {            
                    last USERS if ($bookmarked_node != $$bookmark{to_node});           
                    $users .= ', ' if ($users ne "");
                    $users .= linkNode($$bookmark{from_node});
                } while ($bookmark = $csr->fetchrow_hashref);
            }
            $retstr .= $users;
            $bookmarked_node = $$bookmark{to_node}  if ($bookmark);
            $retstr .= "</li>";
        } while ($bookmark);
    }
    $retstr .= "</ul>";
}

$csr->finish;

return $retstr;
%]
